data.title: Build America Buy America
data.meta_description: The Build America Buy America Act, enacted as part of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act on November 15, 2021, established a domestic content procurement preference for all Federal financial assistance obligated for infrastructure
data.text:
The Build America Buy America Act, enacted as part of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act on November 15, 2021, established a domestic content procurement preference for all Federal financial assistance obligated for infrastructure projects after May 14, 2022. The domestic content procurement preference requires that all iron, steel, manufactured products, and construction materials used in covered infrastructure projects are produced in the United States.

BABA Webpages of Interest:

For general Made in America questions, to include the differences between Buy American and Buy America, visit the Made in America Office (MIAO) webpage: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

For 2 CFR part 184, visit the eCFR webpage: Buy America Preferences for Infrastructure Projects

Copies of OMB memos M-24-02 and M-22-11 as well as a BABA Factsheet and FAQs for award recipients, visit the White House Made in America webpage: OMB Memos M-24-02 and M-22-11 as well as BABA Factsheet and FAQs for Award Recipients

For BABA Final Guidance FAQs and Key Provisions visit The White House Blogs webpage: Biden-Harris Administration Releases Final Guidance to Bolster American-Made Goods in Federal Infrastructure Projects | OMB | The White House

NIST/MEP Supplier Scouting Services: In order to help federal agencies meet their BABA requirements, the U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute for Standards and Technology (NIST), Hollings Manufacturing Extension Partnership (MEP) National Network™ connects U.S. manufacturers that have relevant production capabilities and capacities with additional manufacturers and stakeholders – enabling them to fulfill current market and supply chain needs. Click here for further information on the NIST/MEP supplier scouting services.
